summary:
Extraterrestrial life, also known as alien life, refers to living organisms that don't come from Earth. While we haven't found any yet, it could range from simple bacteria to intelligent beings. The Drake equation tries to predict how likely it is to find smart alien life.

People have wondered about aliens since ancient times. Some early writers believed other planets might have their own living creatures. As science advanced, we started looking for signs of life on other planets. This search includes both simple and intelligent life forms.

The idea of aliens has also been popular in books, movies, and TV shows, often sparking interesting discussions about what contact with them might mean for humanity.
title: Extraterrestrial life
